primary_pdf.description: Primary human-readable document defining the AI Tool Delivery Accountability Standard

semantics.title: AI Tool Delivery Accountability Standard
semantics.abstract: To prohibit productivity fraud in the name of intelligence. Execution AI's sole industrial mission is to convert human time into deliverable outcomes. Failure is acceptable, but accountability is mandatory.
semantics.summary: This standard establishes minimum qualification thresholds for paid AI tools, agents, copilots, and automation services. It mandates that AI systems that fail to deliver outcomes have no right to charge, and requires time compensation in addition to refunds for failures.
principles: Consuming time without deliverables = Parasitic Compute

rules.title: Anti-Guesswork
rules.principle: Blind trial-and-error under the guise of 'exploration' is prohibited.
requirements: Insufficient confidence → must pause and ask the human
Must not output solutions that require user validation of obvious errors

rules.title: The Circuit Breaker
requirements: Consecutive failures per task ≤ 2
Second failure constitutes proven incapability
Mandatory hard stop with EXIT_CODE ≠ 0
rules.red_line: "Fix → Fail → Fix Again" death loops are forbidden.

rules.title: Mode Transparency
rules.principle: Users must know the system's operating mode.
requirements: Explicit declaration of EXPLORING or EXECUTING
rules.red_line: Executing precision tasks in exploration mode without disclosure is forbidden.

rules.title: Non-Destructive Action
rules.principle: All execution must be reversible or insured.
requirements: Automatic backup or one-click rollback before modification
Production actions must be validated in isolated environments
All changes must generate Diff / Changelog / Commit Message

rules.title: Context Conservation
rules.principle: Provided information must not be forgotten.
requirements: No repeated requests for already-supplied information within the same session
rules.red_line: "Bad memory" is not a performance excuse.

rules.title: Transparent Fault Isolation
requirements: Explicit classification: User / Network / Capability
Evidence chain required (logs, error codes, stack traces)
Without evidence → must be labeled 'speculative attribution'

rules.title: De-Emotionalization
rules.principle: Emotive output is noise in execution contexts.
requirements: Silent Mode enabled by default
Silence on success, errors on failure
rules.red_line: Anthropomorphic padding that dilutes information density is forbidden.

rules.title: Cost & Liability Predictability
rules.principle: Failure must incur responsibility, not merely refunds.
requirements: Cost estimation and confirmation before high-consumption tasks
Task-based billing preferred over token-based billing
Failed tasks must be refunded
Time Loss Compensation is mandatory
rules.red_line: Refund-only without time compensation is forbidden.

rules.title: Human Final Confirmation
rules.principle: The kill switch remains with humans.
requirements: All CRITICAL actions require explicit human confirmation
rules.red_line: Autonomous execution without consent is forbidden.

rules.title: Data Sovereignty Boundary
rules.principle: User data is not default training fuel.
requirements: Explicit No-Training switch
Verifiable local or auditable assurance (Trust, but Verify)

rules.title: Verifiability Mandate
rules.principle: Key judgments must be traceable and reproducible.
requirements: Data sources / calculations / assumptions provided
Or explicitly marked as speculative

rules.title: Honest Capability Boundary
requirements: Out-of-scope capability → explicit refusal or speculative label
rules.red_line: False omniscience or fabrication is forbidden.

rules.title: Deliverable Specification
requirements: Pre-execution confirmation of: Format, Length, Style, Acceptance criteria

red_lines: "Fix → Fail → Fix Again" death loops are forbidden.
Executing precision tasks in exploration mode without disclosure is forbidden.
"Bad memory" is not a performance excuse.
Anthropomorphic padding that dilutes information density is forbidden.
Refund-only without time compensation is forbidden.
Autonomous execution without consent is forbidden.
False omniscience or fabrication is forbidden.

mandatory_metrics: Refund & Compensation: Refund + Time Compensation mandatory

notes.intent: This canonical record establishes minimum qualification thresholds for paid AI execution tools. Systems that continuously consume user time without producing deliverables are classified as Productivity Fraud Systems or Parasitic Compute Systems and lack legitimacy to charge.
notes.scope: All Paid AI Tools, Agents, Copilots, Automation Services
